clinical_study.brief_title: Safety Study of Pandemic Candidate Influenza Vaccines in the Elderly Population
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase III, Open, Randomized, Multicenter, Comparative Vaccination Study to Evaluate the Immunogenicity and Reactogenicity of Various Formulations of a Monovalent Candidate Pandemic Influenza A Vaccine in Individuals Over 60 Years of Age

brief_summary.textblock: Influenza pandemics are caused by viruses that possess an Hemagglutinin molecule to which most of the population lacks immunity. If such virus is pathogenic to human and demonstrates the ability to transmit from person to person, the result is a global outbreak of disease that affects a high percentage of individuals in a short period of time and is likely to cause substantially increased mortality and morbidity in all countries of the world. Recently, purely avian influenza viruses, including the H5N1, H9N2 and H7N7 subtypes, have been directly transmitted to humans, raising concern over the possibility of a new influenza pandemic among the world's immunologically naive populations. In order to face this kind of situation, a pandemic influenza vaccine has to be developed.

primary_outcome.measure: Serum Haemagglutination-inhibition (HI) Antibody Titers Against the Influenza A Virus Strain Subtype H9N2 (Anti-H9N2)
primary_outcome.description: Anti-H9N2 antibody titers were expressed as Geometric Mean Titers (GMTs).

primary_outcome.measure: Serum HI Antibody Titers Against the Influenza A Virus Strain Subtype H9N2 (Anti-H9N2)
primary_outcome.description: Anti-H9N2 antibody titers were expressed as Geometric Mean Titers (GMTs).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Seroconverted Subjects Against Influenza A Subtype H9N2
primary_outcome.description: Seroconversion rate was defined as the percentage of vaccinees who had a pre-vaccination HI titer lower than (<) 1:10 and a post-vaccination titre higher than or equal to (≥) 1:40, or a pre-vaccination titer ≥ 1:10 and a minimum four-fold increase in post-vaccination titer

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Seroconverted Subjects Against Influenza A Subtype H9N2
primary_outcome.description: Seroconversion rate was defined as the percentage of vaccinees who had a pre-vaccination HI titer < 1:10 and a post-vaccination titre ≥ 1:40, or a pre-vaccination titer ≥ 1:10 and a minimum four-fold increase in post-vaccination titer

primary_outcome.measure: Seroconversion Factor for Influenza A Subtype H9N2
primary_outcome.description: Seroconversion factor was defined as the fold increase in serum HI GMTs on day 10 compared to day 0.

primary_outcome.measure: Seroconversion Factor for Influenza A Subtype H9N2
primary_outcome.description: Seroconversion factor was defined as the fold increase in serum HI GMTs on day 21 compared to day 0.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Seroprotected Subjects Against H9N2
primary_outcome.description: Seroprotection rate was defined as the percentage of vaccinees with a serum HI titer ≥ 1:40 after vaccination (for each vaccine strain) that usually was accepted as indicating protection.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Seroprotected Subjects Against H9N2
primary_outcome.description: Seroprotection rate was defined as the percentage of vaccinees with a serum HI titer ≥ 1:40 after vaccination (for each vaccine strain) that usually was accepted as indicating protection.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Seroprotection Power Against H9N2
primary_outcome.description: Seroprotection power was defined as the proportion of subjects who were unprotected prior to the vaccination (HI titer < 1:40 on day 0) and had a protective post-vaccination titer of ≥ 1:40.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Seroprotection Power Against H9N2
primary_outcome.description: Seroprotection power was defined as the proportion of subjects who were unprotected prior to the vaccination (HI titer < 1:40 on day 0) and had a protective post-vaccination titer of ≥ 1:40.

primary_outcome.measure: Serum HI Antibody Titers Against the Influenza A Virus Strain Subtype H9N2 (Anti-H9N2)
primary_outcome.description: Anti-H9N2 antibody titers were expressed as Geometric Mean Titers (GMTs).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Unsolicited Adverse Events (AEs)
secondary_outcome.description: An unsolicited AE covers any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical investigation subject temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered related to the medicinal product and reported in addition to those solicited during the clinical study and any solicited symptom with onset outside the specified period of follow-up for solicited symptoms. Any was defined as the occurrence of any unsolicited AE regardless of intensity grade or relation to vaccination.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
secondary_outcome.description: A SAE was any untoward medical occurrence which resulted in death, was life-threatening, resulted in hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization, resulted in permanent of serious physical disability or incapacity, caused a congenital anomaly or birth defect in the offspring of a subject or might have put the subject at risk based on medical or scientific judgment or necessitated intervention to prevent such an event (e.q. invasive or malignant cancers, intensive treatment in an emergency room or at home for bronchospasm, blood dyscrasias, or convulsion that do not resulted in hospitalization).

secondary_outcome.measure: Frequency of Antigen-specific Cluster of Differentiation 4 (CD4) T-cells
secondary_outcome.description: Among expressed immune markers were interferon-gamma (IFN-γ) and cluster of differentiation 40 - ligand (CD40-L).
Among expressed immune markers were interleukin-2 (IL-2) and tumour necrosis factor-alpha (TNF-α).

Among expressed immune markers were interleukin-2 (IL-2), interferon-gamma (IFN-γ), tumour necrosis factor-alpha (TNF-α) and cluster of differentiation 40 - ligand (CD40-L). Descriptive comparison of the CMI response after Dose 1 and Dose 2 of the monovalent candidate pandemic influenza A vaccine. CMI response was determined in terms of the proportion of lymphocytes (CD4+ and CD8+ per million T cells) activated in vitro by the vaccine antigen on Days 10 and 21 after the Dose 1 and on Day 21 after Dose 2 as compared to Day 0 (pre-vaccination). The results were calculated based on the individual difference between each post-vaccination timepoint (Day 10, Day 21, Day 42) and Day 0.

secondary_outcome.measure: Frequency of Antigen-specific Cluster of Differentiation 8 (CD8) T-cells
secondary_outcome.description: Among expressed immune markers were interferon-gamma (IFN-γ) and cluster of differentiation 40 - ligand (CD40-L).
Among expressed immune markers were interleukin-2 (IL-2) and tumour necrosis factor-alpha (TNF-α).

Among expressed immune markers were interleukin-2 (IL-2), interferon-gamma (IFN-γ), tumour necrosis factor-alpha (TNF-α) and cluster of differentiation 40 - ligand (CD40-L). Descriptive comparison of the CMI response after Dose 1 and Dose 2 of the monovalent candidate pandemic influenza A vaccine. The results were calculated based on the individual difference between each post-vaccination timepoint (Day 10, Day 21, Day 42) and Day 0.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Solicited Local Symptoms
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the 4-days post Dose 1 (Days 0-3), post Dose 2 (Days 21-24) and across these doses
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed solicited local symptoms were pain, redness, swelling. Any = occurrence of any local symptom regardless of intensity grade. Grade 3 pain = pain which prevents normal everyday activities. Grade 3 redness/swelling = redness/swelling spreading beyond 50 millimeters (mm).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Solicited Local Symptoms
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the 4 Days post Dose 3 (Days 189-192 for Subset 1 groups and Days 365-368 for Subset 2 groups)
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed solicited local symptoms were pain, redness, swelling. Any = occurrence of any local symptom regardless of intensity grade. Grade 3 pain = pain which prevents normal everyday activities. Grade 3 redness/swelling = redness/swelling spreading beyond 50 millimeters (mm).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Solicited General Symptoms
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed solicited general symptoms were arthralgia, fatigue, fever [defined as axillary temperature higher than (≥) 37.5 degrees Celsius (°C)], headache, myalgia, shivering and sweating. Any = occurrence of any solicited general symptom regardless of intensity grade or relationship to the study vaccination. Grade 3 symptom = symptoms that prevented normal activity. Grade 3 fever = axillary temperature higher than (>) 39°C. Related symptom = symptom assessed by the investigator as being casually related to the study vaccination.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Unsolicited AEs
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the 30-days post Dose 3 (Days 189-219 for Subset 1 groups and Days 365-395 for Subset 2 groups)
secondary_outcome.description: An unsolicited AE covers any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical investigation subject temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered related to the medicinal product and reported in addition to those solicited during the clinical study and any solicited symptom with onset outside the specified period of follow-up for solicited symptoms. Any was defined as the occurrence of any unsolicited AE regardless of intensity grade or relation to vaccination.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within the 365-day post-vaccination period (Days 0-364 for Subset 1 groups) and within the 395-day post-vaccination period (Days 0-394 for Subset 2 groups)
secondary_outcome.description: A SAE was any untoward medical occurrence which resulted in death, was life-threatening, resulted in hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization, resulted in permanent of serious physical disability or incapacity, caused a congenital anomaly or birth defect in the offspring of a subject or might have put the subject at risk based on medical or scientific judgment or necessitated intervention to prevent such an event (e.q. invasive or malignant cancers, intensive treatment in an emergency room or at home for bronchospasm, blood dyscrasias, or convulsion that do not resulted in hospitalization).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Any SAEs
secondary_outcome.description: A SAE was any untoward medical occurrence which resulted in death, was life-threatening, resulted in hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization, resulted in permanent of serious physical disability or incapacity, caused a congenital anomaly or birth defect in the offspring of a subject or might have put the subject at risk based on medical or scientific judgment or necessitated intervention to prevent such an event (e.q. invasive or malignant cancers, intensive treatment in an emergency room or at home for bronchospasm, blood dyscrasias, or convulsion that do not resulted in hospitalization). Only Subset 2 groups had available data for the specified time frame.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Antibody Persistence
secondary_outcome.description: Antibody persistence was evaluated in terms of seroprotection rate (SPR) against influenza A subtype H9N2 and seroconversion rate (SCR) against influenza A subtype H9N2.

secondary_outcome.measure: Seroconversion Factor (SCF) for Influenza A Subtype H9N2.
secondary_outcome.description: SCF was defined as the fold increase in serum HI GMTs at the post-vaccination time points compared to Day 0, for each vaccine strain.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- Subjects who the investigator believes that they can and will comply with the requirements of the protocol
- A male or female aged over 60 years at the time of vaccination.
- Written informed consent obtained from the subject.
Exclusion criteria:
- Use of any investigational or non-registered product (drug or vaccine) other than the study vaccine(s) within 30 days preceding the administration of the study vaccine, or planned use during the study period.
- Participation in an earlier study with a candidate pandemic H9N2 vaccine.
- Acute disease at the time of enrolment.
- Acute clinically significant pulmonary, cardiovascular, hepatic or renal functional abnormality
- History of allergic disease or reactions likely to be exacerbated by any component of the vaccine.
- Drug and/or alcohol dependency.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: After Part I, the core study (study period from Visit 1 on Day 0 up to the phone contact on Day 51), the enrolled subjects were stratified into Subset 1 (Part II – Visit 5 on Day 189 to study conclusion, i.e ., Visit 7 on Day 365) or Subset 2 (Part II – Visit 6 on Day 365 to study conclusion, i.e ., phone contact on Day 395).

outcome.title: Serum Haemagglutination-inhibition (HI) Antibody Titers Against the Influenza A Virus Strain Subtype H9N2 (Anti-H9N2)
outcome.description: Anti-H9N2 antibody titers were expressed as Geometric Mean Titers (GMTs).
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the According-To-Protocol (ATP) cohort for immunogenicity which included all evaluable subjects for whom data concerning immunogenicity outcome measures were available. This included subjects for whom assay results were available for antibodies against at least one study vaccine antigen component after vaccination.

measure.title: Serum HI Antibody Titers Against the Influenza A Virus Strain Subtype H9N2 (Anti-H9N2)
measure.description: Anti-H9N2 antibody titers were expressed as Geometric Mean Titers (GMTs).
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the According-To-Protocol (ATP) cohort for immunogenicity which included all evaluable subjects for whom data concerning immunogenicity outcome measures were available. This included subjects for whom assay results were available for antibodies against at least one study vaccine antigen component after vaccination.

outcome.title: Number of Seroconverted Subjects Against Influenza A Subtype H9N2
outcome.description: Seroconversion rate was defined as the percentage of vaccinees who had a pre-vaccination HI titer lower than (<) 1:10 and a post-vaccination titre higher than or equal to (≥) 1:40, or a pre-vaccination titer ≥ 1:10 and a minimum four-fold increase in post-vaccination titer

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Seroprotection Power Against H9N2
outcome.description: Seroprotection power was defined as the proportion of subjects who were unprotected prior to the vaccination (HI titer < 1:40 on day 0) and had a protective post-vaccination titer of ≥ 1:40.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the According-To-Protocol (ATP) cohort for persistence, which included all evaluable subjects for whom data concerning persistence of the immune response induced by the vaccine were available for the specified time points.

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Seroprotection Power Against H9N2
measure.description: Seroprotection power was defined as the proportion of subjects who were unprotected prior to the vaccination (HI titer < 1:40 on day 0) and had a protective post-vaccination titer of ≥ 1:40.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the According-To-Protocol (ATP) cohort for persistence, which included all evaluable subjects for whom data concerning persistence of the immune response induced by the vaccine were available for the specified time points.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Unsolicited Adverse Events (AEs)
outcome.description: An unsolicited AE covers any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical investigation subject temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered related to the medicinal product and reported in addition to those solicited during the clinical study and any solicited symptom with onset outside the specified period of follow-up for solicited symptoms. Any was defined as the occurrence of any unsolicited AE regardless of intensity grade or relation to vaccination.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated Cohort (TVc), which included all vaccinated subjects.

measure.description: An unsolicited AE covers any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical investigation subject temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered related to the medicinal product and reported in addition to those solicited during the clinical study and any solicited symptom with onset outside the specified period of follow-up for solicited symptoms. outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
outcome.description: A SAE was any untoward medical occurrence which resulted in death, was life-threatening, resulted in hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization, resulted in permanent of serious physical disability or incapacity, caused a congenital anomaly or birth defect in the offspring of a subject or might have put the subject at risk based on medical or scientific judgment or necessitated intervention to prevent such an event (e.q. invasive or malignant cancers, intensive treatment in an emergency room or at home for bronchospasm, blood dyscrasias, or convulsion that do not resulted in hospitalization).
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated Cohort (TVc), which included all vaccinated subjects.

measure.title: Frequency of Antigen-specific CD4 T-cells
measure.description: Among expressed immune markers were interleukin-2 (IL-2) and tumour necrosis factor-alpha (TNF-α).
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the According-To-Protocol (ATP) cohort for immunogenicity which included all evaluable subjects for whom data concerning immunogenicity outcome measures were available. This included subjects for whom assay results were available for antibodies against at least one study vaccine antigen component after vaccination.

outcome.title: Cytokine-positive CD4 T-cells Frequency
outcome.description: Among expressed immune markers were interleukin-2 (IL-2), interferon-gamma (IFN-γ), tumour necrosis factor-alpha (TNF-α) and cluster of differentiation 40 - ligand (CD40-L). Descriptive comparison of the CMI response after Dose 1 and Dose 2 of the monovalent candidate pandemic influenza A vaccine. CMI response was determined in terms of the proportion of lymphocytes (CD4+ and CD8+ per million T cells) activated in vitro by the vaccine antigen on Days 10 and 21 after the Dose 1 and on Day 21 after Dose 2 as compared to Day 0 (pre-vaccination). The results were calculated based on the individual difference between each post-vaccination timepoint (Day 10, Day 21, Day 42) and Day 0.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the According-To-Protocol (ATP) cohort for immunogenicity which included all evaluable subjects for whom data concerning immunogenicity outcome measures were available. This included subjects for whom assay results were available for antibodies against at least one study vaccine antigen component after vaccination.

measure.population: The analysis was performed on the According-To-Protocol (ATP) cohort for immunogenicity which included all evaluable subjects for whom data concerning immunogenicity outcome measures were available. This included subjects for whom assay results were available for antibodies against at least one study vaccine antigen component after vaccination.

outcome.title: Cytokine-positive CD8 T-cells Frequency
outcome.description: Among expressed immune markers were interleukin-2 (IL-2), interferon-gamma (IFN-γ), tumour necrosis factor-alpha (TNF-α) and cluster of differentiation 40 - ligand (CD40-L). Descriptive comparison of the CMI response after Dose 1 and Dose 2 of the monovalent candidate pandemic influenza A vaccine. CMI response was determined in terms of the proportion of lymphocytes (CD4+ and CD8+ per million T cells) activated in vitro by the vaccine antigen on Days 10 and 21 after the Dose 1 and on Day 21 after Dose 2 as compared to Day 0 (pre-vaccination). The results were calculated based on the individual difference between each post-vaccination timepoint (Day 10, Day 21, Day 42) and Day 0.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the According-To-Protocol (ATP) cohort for immunogenicity which included all evaluable subjects for whom data concerning immunogenicity outcome measures were available. This included subjects for whom assay results were available for antibodies against at least one study vaccine antigen component after vaccination.

measure.title: Serum HI Antibody Titers Against the Influenza A Virus Strain Subtype H9N2 (Anti-H9N2)
measure.description: Anti-H9N2 antibody titers were expressed as Geometric Mean Titers (GMTs).
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the According-To-Protocol (ATP) cohort for persistence, which included all evaluable subjects for whom data concerning persistence of the immune response induced by the vaccine were available for the specified time points.

outcome.title: Number of Seroconverted Subjects Against Influenza A Subtype H9N2
outcome.description: Seroconversion rate was defined as the percentage of vaccinees who had a pre-vaccination HI titer < 1:10 and a post-vaccination titre ≥ 1:40, or a pre-vaccination titer ≥ 1:10 and a minimum four-fold increase in postvaccination titer
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the According-To-Protocol (ATP) cohort for immunogenicity which included all evaluable subjects for whom data concerning immunogenicity outcome measures were available. This included subjects for whom assay results were available for antibodies against at least one study vaccine antigen component after vaccination.

measure.description: Seroconversion rate was defined as the percentage of vaccinees who had a pre-vaccination HI titer < 1:10 and a post-vaccination titre ≥ 1:40, or a pre-vaccination titer ≥ 1:10 and a minimum four-fold increase in post-vaccination titer

outcome.title: Seroconversion Factor for Influenza A Subtype H9N2
outcome.description: Seroconversion factor defined as the fold increase in serum HI GMTs on day 21 post Dose 3 (Day 42) compared to day 0.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the According-To-Protocol (ATP) cohort for immunogenicity which included all evaluable subjects for whom data concerning immunogenicity outcome measures were available. This included subjects for whom assay results were available for antibodies against at least one study vaccine antigen component after vaccination.

measure.title: Seroconversion Factor for Influenza A Subtype H9N2
measure.description: Seroconversion factor was defined as the fold increase in serum HI GMTs on day 21 post Dose 3 (Day 210 for Subset 1 and Day 386 for Subset 2) compared to day 0.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the According-To-Protocol (ATP) cohort for persistence, which included all evaluable subjects for whom data concerning persistence of the immune response induced by the vaccine were available for the specified time points.

outcome.title: Number of Seroprotected Subjects Against H9N2
outcome.description: Seroprotection rate was defined as the percentage of vaccinees with a serum HI titer ≥ 1:40 after vaccination (for each vaccine strain) that usually was accepted as indicating protection.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the According-To-Protocol (ATP) cohort for immunogenicity which included all evaluable subjects for whom data concerning immunogenicity outcome measures were available. This included subjects for whom assay results were available for antibodies against at least one study vaccine antigen component after vaccination.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Seroprotection Power Against H9N2
outcome.description: Seroprotection power was defined as the proportion of subjects who were unprotected prior to the vaccination (HI titer < 1:40 on day 0) and had a protective post-vaccination titer of ≥ 1:40.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Solicited Local Symptoms
outcome.description: Assessed solicited local symptoms were pain, redness, swelling. Any = occurrence of any local symptom regardless of intensity grade. Grade 3 pain = pain which prevents normal everyday activities. Grade 3 redness/swelling = redness/swelling spreading beyond 50 millimeters (mm).
outcome.time_frame: During the 4-days post Dose 1 (Days 0-3), post Dose 2 (Days 21-24) and across these doses
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated Cohort (TVc) included all vaccinated subjects (for whom diary card was available).

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Solicited Local Symptoms
measure.description: Assessed solicited local symptoms were pain, redness, swelling. Any = occurrence of any local symptom regardless of intensity grade. Grade 3 pain = pain which prevents normal everyday activities. Grade 3 redness/swelling = redness/swelling spreading beyond 50 millimeters (mm).
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated Cohort (TVc) of Subsets, which included all vaccinated subjects (for whom the diary card was available).

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Solicited General Symptoms
outcome.description: Assessed solicited general symptoms were arthralgia, fatigue, fever [defined as axillary temperature higher than (≥) 37.5 degrees Celsius (°C)], headache, myalgia, shivering and sweating. Any = occurrence of any solicited general symptom regardless of intensity grade or relationship to the study vaccination. Grade 3 symptom = symptoms that prevented normal activity. Grade 3 fever = axillary temperature higher than (>) 39°C. Related symptom = symptom assessed by the investigator as being casually related to the study vaccination.

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Unsolicited AEs
measure.description: An unsolicited AE covers any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical investigation subject temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered related to the medicinal product and reported in addition to those solicited during the clinical study and any solicited symptom with onset outside the specified period of follow-up for solicited symptoms. measure.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated Cohort (TVc) of Subsets, which included all vaccinated subjects (for whom the diary card was available).

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With SAEs
outcome.description: A SAE was any untoward medical occurrence which resulted in death, was life-threatening, resulted in hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization, resulted in permanent of serious physical disability or incapacity, caused a congenital anomaly or birth defect in the offspring of a subject or might have put the subject at risk based on medical or scientific judgment or necessitated intervention to prevent such an event (e.q. invasive or malignant cancers, intensive treatment in an emergency room or at home for bronchospasm, blood dyscrasias, or convulsion that do not resulted in hospitalization).
outcome.time_frame: Within the 365-day post-vaccination period (Days 0-364 for Subset 1 groups) and within the 395-day post-vaccination period (Days 0-394 for Subset 2 groups)
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated Cohort (TVc) of Subsets, which included all vaccinated subjects (for whom the diary card was available).

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Any SAEs
measure.description: A SAE was any untoward medical occurrence which resulted in death, was life-threatening, resulted in hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization, resulted in permanent of serious physical disability or incapacity, caused a congenital anomaly or birth defect in the offspring of a subject or might have put the subject at risk based on medical or scientific judgment or necessitated intervention to prevent such an event (e.q. invasive or malignant cancers, intensive treatment in an emergency room or at home for bronchospasm, blood dyscrasias, or convulsion that do not resulted in hospitalization). Only Subset 2 groups had available data for the specified time frame.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated Cohort (TVc) of Subset 2, which included all vaccinated subjects (for whom the diary card was available).

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Antibody Persistence
outcome.description: Antibody persistence was evaluated in terms of seroprotection rate (SPR) against influenza A subtype H9N2 and seroconversion rate (SCR) against influenza A subtype H9N2.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the According-To-Protocol (ATP) cohort for persistence, which included all evaluable subjects for whom data concerning persistence of the immune response induced by the vaccine were available for the specified time points.

reported_events.time_frame: Solicited local and general symptoms: during the 4-day (Days 0-3) post-vaccination period; Unsolicited AEs: during the 30-day (Days 0-29) post-vaccination period; SAEs: up to Day 51.
reported_events.desc: One subject from the SB218352_15 Group reported both SAE(s) included in the Adverse Events section.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: GSK agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. GSK supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.
